info.title: iNaturalist API
info.description:
# https://api.inaturalist.org/v1/

[iNaturalist](https://www.inaturalist.org/) is a global community of
naturalists, scientists, and members of the public sharing over a million
wildlife sightings to teach one another about the natural world while
creating high quality citizen science data for science and conservation.

These API methods return data in JSON/JSONP and PNG response formats. They
are meant to supplement the existing [iNaturalist
API](https://www.inaturalist.org/pages/api+reference), implemented in Ruby
on Rails, which has more functionality and supports more write operations,
but tends to be slower and have less consistent response formats. Visit our
[developers page](https://www.inaturalist.org/pages/developers) for more
information. Write operations that expect and return JSON describe a single
`body` parameter that represents the request body, which should be specified
as JSON. See the "Model" of each body parameter for attributes that we
accept in these JSON objects.

Multiple values for a single URL parameter should be separated by commas,
e.g. `taxon_id=1,2,3`.

Map tiles are generated using the
[node-mapnik](https://github.com/mapnik/node-mapnik) library, following the
XYZ map tiling scheme. The "Observation Tile" methods accept nearly all the
parameters of the observation search APIs, and will generate map tiles
reflecting the same observations returned by searches. These
"Observation Tile" methods have corresponding
[UTFGrid](https://github.com/mapbox/utfgrid-spec) JSON
responses which return information needed to make interactive maps.

Authentication in the Node API is handled via JSON Web Tokens (JWT). To
obtain one, make an [OAuth-authenticated
request](http://www.inaturalist.org/pages/api+reference#auth) to
https://www.inaturalist.org/users/api_token. Each JWT will expire after 24
hours. Authentication required for all PUT and POST requests. Some GET
requests will also include private information like hidden coordinates if
the authenticated user has permission to view them.

Photos served from https://static.inaturalist.org and
https://inaturalist-open-data.s3.amazonaws.com have multiple size
variants and not all size variants are returned in responses. To access
other sizes, the photo URL can be modified to replace only the size
qualifier (each variant shares the exact same extension). The domain a photo
is hosted under reflects the license under which the photo is being shared,
and the domain may change over time if the license changes. Photos in
the `inaturalist-open-data` domain are shared under open licenses. These can
be accessed in bulk in the [iNaturalist AWS Open Dataset](
https://registry.opendata.aws/inaturalist-open-data/). Photos in the
`static.inaturalist.org` domain do not have open licenses.

The available photo sizes are:
* original (max 2048px in either dimension)
* large (max 1024px in either dimension)
* medium (max 500px in either dimension)
* small (max 240px in either dimension)
* thumb (max 100px in either dimension)
* square (75px square)

iNaturalist Website: https://www.inaturalist.org/

Open Source Software: https://github.com/inaturalist/

## Terms of Use

Use of this API is subject to the iNaturalist
[Terms of Service](https://www.inaturalist.org/terms) and
[Privacy Policy](https://www.inaturalist.org/privacy). We will block any
use of our API that violates our Terms or Privacy Policy without notice.
The API is intended to support application development, not data scraping.
For pre- generated data exports, see
https://www.inaturalist.org/pages/developers.

Please note that we throttle API usage to a max of 100 requests per minute,
though we ask that you try to keep it to 60 requests per minute or lower,
and to keep under 10,000 requests per day. If we notice usage that has
serious impact on our performance we may institute blocks without
notification.

Terms of Service: https://www.inaturalist.org/terms

Privacy Policy: https://www.inaturalist.org/privacy

tags.name: Observations
tags.description: CRUD, search, faving, quality metrics, stats, and more

tags.name: Projects
tags.description: Search and fetch projects and members

tags.name: Polygon Tiles
tags.description: Place geometry and taxon range tiles

get.description: List all attribute controlled terms
Returns attribute controlled terms relevant to a taxon

post.description:
Create a flag. To create a custom flag beyond the standard `spam` and
`inappropriate` flags, set `flag` to `other` and include a `flag_explanation`

put.description: Update a flag. Generally only used to resolve the flag.

get.description:
Given an ID, or an array of IDs in comma-delimited format, returns
corresponding identifications. A maximum of 30 results will be returned

put.description:
Update an identification. Note that to "withdraw" an observation you
send a `PUT` request to this endpoint and set the `current`
attribute to false. To "restore" it you do the same but set
`current` to `true`. Only one identification by a given user can be
`current` for a given observation, so if you "restore" one all the other
identifications by the authenticated user for the given observation will
be withdrawn.

delete.description:
Delete an identification. See description of `PUT /identifications/{id}
for notes on withdrawing and restoring identifications.

get.description:
Given zero to many of following parameters, returns identifications
matching the search criteria

Given zero to many of following parameters, return counts of the
categories of identifications matching the search criteria

Given zero to many of following parameters, returns `leaf taxa`
associated with identifications matching the search criteria and the
count of identifications they are associated with, ordered by count
descending. `Leaf taxa` are the leaves of the taxonomic tree containing
only the taxa associated with observations matching the search criteria.

parameters.name: taxon_of
parameters.description: Source of the taxon for counting

200.description: Returns an object with metadata and an array of taxa

get.description:
Given zero to many of following parameters, returns creators of
identifications matching the search criteria and the count of
matching identifications, ordered by count descending. A
maximum of 500 results will be returned

200.description: Returns an object with metadata and an array of identifiers

get.description:
Given zero to many of following parameters, returns creators of
observations of identifications matching the search criteria and
the count of matching observations, ordered by count descending

200.description: Returns an object with metadata and an array of observers

get.description:
Returns an array of objects each containing an identification and a
taxon. Returns IDs representing the earliest occurrence of taxa
associated with identifications in the filtered set of results

Returns species attached to IDs of observations of this taxon, or
attached to observations identified as this species, ordered by combined
frequency descending. This will only return species in the same iconic
taxon, and will never return descendants of the chosen taxon

parameters.name: taxon_id
parameters.description: Only show observations of these taxa and their descendants

get.summary: Retrieve messages for the authenticated user. This does not mark them as read.
get.description: Show the user's inbox or sent box

parameters.name: box
parameters.description: Whether to view messages the user has received (default) or messages the user has sent

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Search query for subject and body

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: User ID or username of correspondent to filter by

parameters.name: threads
parameters.description:
Groups results by `thread_id`, only shows the latest message per
thread, and includes a `thread_messages_count` attribute showing the
total number of messages in that thread. Note that this will not
work with the `q` param, and it probably should only be used with
`box=any` because the `thread_messages_count` will be inaccurate when
you restrict it to `inbox` or `sent`.

default.description: Returns an object with metadata and an array of messages

post.description: Create and deliver a new message to another user

get.description:
Retrieves all messages in the thread the specified message belongs to
and marks them all as read.

200.description: Returns an object with metadata and an array of messages

flaggable_message_id.description:
Identifier for the message that should be flagged if the user
chooses to flag this thread

delete.description:
This will all of the authenticated user's copies of the messages in tha
thread to which the specified message belongs.

200.description: No return data, 200 just means deletion was successful

get.summary: Gets a count of messages the authenticated user has not read

get.description:
Given an ID, or an array of IDs in comma-delimited format, returns
corresponding observations. A maximum of 200 results will be returned

200.description: Returns an object with metadata and an array of observations

get.description:
Fetches any subscriptions the current user has to this observation
or the observer

post.description: Set the value of a quality metric

get.description:
Fetches information about this observation's taxon, within the context
of this observation's location

post.description:
Toggles current user's subscription to this observation. If the logged-in
user is not subscribed, POSTing here will subscribe them. If they are already
subscribed, this will remove the subscription

Vote on an observation. A vote with an empty `scope` is recorded as a
`fave` of the observation. A vote with scope `needs_id` is recorded as a
vote on the Quality Grade criterion "can the Community ID still be
confirmed or improved?", and can be an up or down vote

delete.description: Remove a vote from an observation

get.description:
Given zero to many of following parameters, returns observations
matching the search criteria. The large size of the observations index
prevents us from supporting the `page` parameter when retrieving records
from large result sets. If you need to retrieve large numbers of
records, use the `per_page` and `id_above` or `id_below` parameters
instead.

200.description: Returns an object with metadata and an array of observations

get.description:
Given a starting date, return an array of IDs of the authenticated
user's observations that have been deleted since that date. Requires
authentication

Given zero to many of following parameters, returns histogram data about
observations matching the search criteria

200.description: Returns an object with metadata and an array of histogram data

get.description:
Given zero to many of following parameters, returns identifiers of
observations matching the search criteria and the count of
observations they have identified, ordered by count descending. A
maximum of 500 results will be returned

200.description: Returns an object with metadata and an array of identifiers

get.description:
Given zero to many of following parameters, returns observers of
observations matching the search criteria and the count of
observations and distinct taxa of rank `species` they have observed. A
maximum of 500 results will be returned

200.description: Returns an object with metadata and an array of observers

get.description:
Given zero to many of following parameters, returns an array of
relevant controlled terms values and a monthly histogram

Given zero to many of following parameters, returns `leaf taxa`
associated with observations matching the search criteria and the count of
observations they are associated with, ordered by count descending.
`Leaf taxa` are the leaves of the taxonomic tree containing only the
taxa associated with observations matching the search criteria.

200.description: Returns an object with metadata and an array of taxa

get.description:
Given zero to many of following parameters, returns an array of objects
representing new comments and identifications on observations the authenticated
user has subscribed to. Requires authentication

put.description: Mark all updates associated with this observation as viewed by logged-in user

parameters.name: observation_photo[position]
parameters.description: Position in which the photo is displayed for the observation

get.description:
Given an ID, or an array of IDs in comma-delimited format, returns
corresponding places. A maximum of 500 results will be returned

parameters.name: admin_level
parameters.description:
Admin level of a place, or an array of admin levels
in comma-delimited format. Supported admin levels are: -10
(continent), 0 (country), 10 (state), 20 (county), 30 (town),
100 (park)

200.description: Returns an object with metadata and an results array of places

get.description:
Given an string, returns places with names starting with the search
term.

200.description: Returns an object with metadata and an results array of places

get.description:
Given an bounding box, and an optional name query, return `standard`
iNaturalist curator approved and `community` non-curated places nearby

200.description:
Returns an object with metadata and an results object containing
`standard` and `community` places

get.description: Return journal posts from the iNaturalist site

Return journal posts from the iNaturalist site. If the user is logged-in,
also return posts from projects the user is subscribed to

parameters.name: newer_than
parameters.description: returns posts newer than the post with this ID

parameters.name: older_than
parameters.description: returns posts older than the post with this ID

post.description: Add an observation to a project

get.description:
Given zero to many of following parameters, returns projects
matching the search criteria

200.description: Returns an object with metadata and an array of projects

get.description:
Given an ID, or an array of IDs in comma-delimited format, returns
corresponding projects. A maximum of 100 results will be returned

200.description: Returns an object with metadata and an array of projects

get.description: Given an ID, return members of the project

200.description: Returns an object with metadata and an results array of projects

get.description:
Given an ID, or an array of IDs in comma-delimited format, return the details of the
authenticated user's membership in these projects

[Deprecated] Subscriptions to projects are managed through joining and
leaving projects, so this will not return any useful information.

Given an ID, return subscription of the current user

post.description: Add an observation to a project

delete.description: Remove an observation from a project

get.description: Given an string, returns projects with titles starting with the search term

200.description: Returns an object with metadata and an results array of places

get.description: Given zero to many of following parameters, returns object matching the search criteria

post.description:
Toggles current user's subscription to this project. If the logged-in
user is not subscribed, POSTing here will subscribe them. If they are already
subscribed, this will remove the subscription

get.description:
Given an ID, or an array of IDs in comma-delimited format, returns
corresponding taxa. A maximum of 30 results will be returned

200.description: Returns an object with metadata and a results array of taxa

get.description: Given zero to many of following parameters, returns taxa matching the search criteria

200.description: Returns an object with search metadata and a results array of taxa

get.description: Given an string, returns taxa with names starting with the search term

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of results to return in a `page`. The maximum value is 30 for this endpoint

200.description: Returns an object with search metadata and a results array of taxa

get.description: Given an ID, returns corresponding user
Return projects as user has joined / followed
Given an string, returns users with names or logins starting with the search term
Fetch the logged-in user

post.description:
Make it so the authenticated user stops receiving notifications about
activity by the user specified by {id}.

200.description: Returns an empty 200 response on success

delete.description: Remove a mute on the user specified by {id}

200.description: Returns an empty 200 response on success

get.description:
Given zero to many of following parameters, returns a PNG image
representing the matching observations within a map tile, following
the XYZ tiling scheme

200.description: Returns a PNG map tile image

get.description:
Given zero to many of following parameters, returns a JSON file
following the UTFGrid spec, representing observations matching
the search criteria

Given zero to many of following parameters, returns a PNG image
representing the matching observations within a map tile, following
the XYZ tiling scheme

200.description: Returns a PNG map tile image

get.description:
Given zero to many of following parameters, returns a JSON file
following the UTFGrid spec, representing observations matching
the search criteria

Given zero to many of following parameters, returns a PNG image
representing the matching observations within a map tile, following
the XYZ tiling scheme

200.description: Returns a PNG map tile image

get.description:
Given zero to many of following parameters, returns a JSON file
following the UTFGrid spec, representing observations matching
the search criteria

Given zero to many of following parameters, returns a PNG image
representing the matching observations within a map tile, following
the XYZ tiling scheme

200.description: Returns a PNG map tile image

get.description:
Given zero to many of following parameters, returns a JSON file
following the UTFGrid spec, representing observations matching
the search criteria

Returns a PNG map tile representing the boundary of this place,
following the XYZ tiling scheme

200.description: Returns a PNG map tile image

get.description:
Returns a PNG map tile representing the boundaries of places this taxon
is known to occur, following the XYZ tiling scheme

200.description: Returns a PNG map tile image

get.description:
Returns a PNG map tile representing the range of this taxon, following
the XYZ tiling scheme

200.description: Returns a PNG map tile image

acc.name: acc
acc.description: Whether or not positional accuracy / coordinate uncertainty has been specified

endemic.name: endemic
endemic.description: Observations whose taxa are endemic to their location

id_please.name: id_please
id_please.description: Observations with the deprecated `ID, Please!` flag. Note that this will return observations, but that this attribute is no longer used.

ident_user_id.name: ident_user_id
ident_user_id.description: Observations identified by a particular user

introduced.name: introduced
introduced.description: Observations whose taxa are introduced in their location

mappable.name: mappable
mappable.description: Observations that show on map tiles

native.name: native
native.description: Observations whose taxa are native to their location

out_of_range.name: out_of_range
out_of_range.description: Observations whose taxa are outside their known ranges

pcid.name: pcid
pcid.description:
Observations identified by the curator of a project. If
the `project_id` parameter is also specified, this will only consider
observations identified by curators of the specified project(s)

popular.name: popular
popular.description: Observations that have been favorited by at least one user

threatened.name: threatened
threatened.description: Observations whose taxa are threatened in their location

verifiable.name: verifiable
verifiable.description:
Observations with a `quality_grade` of either `needs_id` or
`research`. Equivalent to `quality_grade=needs_id,research`

licensed.name: licensed
licensed.description: License attribute of an observation must not be null

photo_licensed.name: photo_licensed
photo_licensed.description: License attribute of at least one photo of an observation must not be null

hour.name: hour
hour.description: Must be observed within this hour of the day

day.name: day
day.description: Must be observed within this day of the month

created_day.name: created_day
created_day.description: Must be created within this day of the month

month.name: month
month.description: Must be observed within this month

created_month.name: created_month
created_month.description: Must be created within this month

term_id.name: term_id
term_id.description: Must have an annotation using this controlled term ID

term_value_id.name: term_value_id
term_value_id.description:
Must have an annotation using this controlled value ID. Must be combined
with the `term_id` parameter

without_term_id.name: without_term_id
without_term_id.description: Exclude observations with annotations using this controlled value ID.

without_term_value_id.name: without_term_value_id
without_term_value_id.description:
Exclude observations with annotations using this controlled value ID.
Must be combined with the `term_id` parameter

term_id_or_unknown.name: term_id_or_unknown
term_id_or_unknown.description:
Must be combined with the `term_value_id` or the `without_term_value_id` parameter.
Must have an annotation using this controlled term ID and associated term value IDs
or be missing this annotation.

annotation_user_id.name: annotation_user_id
annotation_user_id.description: Must have an annotation created by this user

ofv_datatype.name: ofv_datatype
ofv_datatype.description: Must have an observation field value with this datatype

photo_license.name: photo_license
photo_license.description: Must have at least one photo with this license

place_id.name: place_id
place_id.description: Must be observed within the place with this ID

project_id.name: project_id
project_id.description: Must be added to the project this ID or slug

site_id.name: site_id
site_id.description: Must be affiliated with the iNaturalist network website with this ID

sound_license.name: sound_license
sound_license.description: Must have at least one sound with this license

taxon_id.name: taxon_id
taxon_id.description: Only show observations of these taxa and their descendants

without_taxon_id.name: without_taxon_id
without_taxon_id.description: Exclude observations of these taxa and their descendants

taxon_name.name: taxon_name
taxon_name.description: Taxon must have a scientific or common name matching this string

user_id.name: user_id
user_id.description: User must have this ID or login

year.name: year
year.description: Must be observed within this year

created_year.name: created_year
created_year.description: Must be created within this year

acc_above.name: acc_above
acc_above.description: Must have a positional accuracy above this value (meters)

acc_below.name: acc_below
acc_below.description: Must have a positional accuracy below this value (meters)

acc_below_or_unknown.name: acc_below_or_unknown
acc_below_or_unknown.description: Positional accuracy must be below this value (in meters) or be unknown

apply_project_rules_for.name: apply_project_rules_for
apply_project_rules_for.description: Must match the rules of the project with this ID or slug

created_d1.name: created_d1
created_d1.description: Must be created at or after this time

created_d2.name: created_d2
created_d2.description: Must be created at or before this time

created_on.name: created_on
created_on.description: Must be created on this date

cs.name: cs
cs.description:
Taxon must have this conservation status code. If
the `place_id` parameter is also specified, this will only consider
statuses specific to that place

csa.name: csa
csa.description:
Taxon must have a conservation status from this authority. If
the `place_id` parameter is also specified, this will only consider
statuses specific to that place

csi.name: csi
csi.description:
Taxon must have this IUCN conservation status. If
the `place_id` parameter is also specified, this will only consider
statuses specific to that place

d1.name: d1
d1.description: Must be observed on or after this date

d2.name: d2
d2.description: Must be observed on or before this date

taxon_geoprivacy.name: taxon_geoprivacy
taxon_geoprivacy.description:
Filter observations by the most conservative geoprivacy applied by a
conservation status associated with one of the taxa proposed in the
current identifications.

obscuration.name: obscuration
obscuration.description: Must have `geoprivacy` or `taxon_geoprivacy` fields matching these values

hrank.name: hrank
hrank.description: Taxon must have this rank or lower

iconic_taxa.name: iconic_taxa
iconic_taxa.description: Taxon must by within this iconic taxon

id_above.name: id_above
id_above.description: Must have an ID above this value

id_below.name: id_below
id_below.description: Must have an ID below this value

lat.name: lat
lat.description:
Must be within a {`radius`} kilometer circle around this lat/lng
(*lat, *lng, radius)

list_id.name: list_id
list_id.description: Taxon must be in the list with this ID

lng.name: lng
lng.description:
Must be within a {`radius`} kilometer circle around this lat/lng
(*lat, *lng, radius)

lrank.name: lrank
lrank.description: Taxon must have this rank or higher

nelat.name: nelat
nelat.description: Must be within this bounding box (*nelat, *nelng, *swlat, *swlng)

nelng.name: nelng
nelng.description: Must be within this bounding box (*nelat, *nelng, *swlat, *swlng)

swlat.name: swlat
swlat.description: Must be within this bounding box (*nelat, *nelng, *swlat, *swlng)

swlng.name: swlng
swlng.description: Must be within this bounding box (*nelat, *nelng, *swlat, *swlng)

not_in_project.name: not_in_project
not_in_project.description: Must not be in the project with this ID or slug

not_matching_project_rules_for.name: not_matching_project_rules_for
not_matching_project_rules_for.description: Must not match the rules of the project with this ID or slug

observation_accuracy_experiment_id.name: observation_accuracy_experiment_id
observation_accuracy_experiment_id.description: Must included in this observation accuracy experiment

fails_dqa_accurate.name: fails_dqa_accurate
fails_dqa_accurate.description: Must be voted as not accurately depicting an organism or scene

fails_dqa_date.name: fails_dqa_date
fails_dqa_date.description: Must be voted as not having an accurate date

fails_dqa_evidence.name: fails_dqa_evidence
fails_dqa_evidence.description: Must be voted as not evidence of an organism

fails_dqa_location.name: fails_dqa_location
fails_dqa_location.description: Must be voted as not having an accurate location

fails_dqa_needs_id.name: fails_dqa_needs_id
fails_dqa_needs_id.description: Must be voted as the community ID cannot be improved

fails_dqa_recent.name: fails_dqa_recent
fails_dqa_recent.description: Must be voted as not recent evidence of an organism

fails_dqa_subject.name: fails_dqa_subject
fails_dqa_subject.description: Must be voted as not having evidence related to a single subject

fails_dqa_wild.name: fails_dqa_wild
fails_dqa_wild.description: Must be voted as not wild

unobserved_by_user_id.name: unobserved_by_user_id
unobserved_by_user_id.description: Must not be of a taxon previously observed by this user

observed_on.name: observed_on
observed_on.description: Must be observed on this date

per_page.name: per_page
per_page.description:
Number of results to return in a `page`. The maximum value is generally
200 unless otherwise noted

per_page_species_counts.name: per_page
per_page_species_counts.description: Number of results to return in a `page`. The maximum value is 500

q.name: q
q.description: Search observation properties. Can be combined with `search_on`

radius.name: radius
radius.description:
Must be within a {`radius`} kilometer circle around this lat/lng
(*lat, *lng, radius)

search_on.name: search_on
search_on.description:
Properties to search on, when combined with `q`.
Searches across all properties by default

ttl.name: ttl
ttl.description:
Set the `Cache-Control` HTTP header with this value as `max-age`, in
seconds. This means subsequent identical requests will be cached on
iNaturalist servers, and commonly within web browsers

updated_since.name: updated_since
updated_since.description: Must be updated since this time

reviewed.name: reviewed
reviewed.description:
Observations have been reviewed by the user with ID equal to
the value of the `viewer_id` parameter

annotation_path_id.name: id
annotation_path_id.description: ID or UUID of the annotation

path_multi_id_or_slug.name: id
path_multi_id_or_slug.description: Must have this ID or slug

autocomplete_q.name: q
autocomplete_q.description: Search by name (must start with this value) or by ID (exact match).

autocomplete_q_not_required.name: q
autocomplete_q_not_required.description: Search by name (must start with this value) or by ID (exact match).

autocomplete_project_id.name: project_id
autocomplete_project_id.description: Only show users with memberships to this project

rank_level.name: rank_level
rank_level.description:
Taxon must have this rank level. Some example values are 70 (kingdom),
60 (phylum), 50 (class), 40 (order), 30 (family), 20 (genus),
10 (species), 5 (subspecies)

parent_id.name: parent_id
parent_id.description: Taxon's parent must have this ID

nelat_required.name: nelat
nelat_required.description: Must be nearby this bounding box (*nelat, *nelng, *swlat, *swlng)

nelng_required.name: nelng
nelng_required.description: Must be nearby this bounding box (*nelat, *nelng, *swlat, *swlng)

swlat_required.name: swlat
swlat_required.description: Must be nearby this bounding box (*nelat, *nelng, *swlat, *swlng)

swlng_required.name: swlng
swlng_required.description: Must be nearby this bounding box (*nelat, *nelng, *swlat, *swlng)

locale.name: locale
locale.description: Locale preference for taxon common names

preferred_place_id.name: preferred_place_id
preferred_place_id.description: Place preference for regional taxon common names

zoom.name: zoom
zoom.description: Zoom level. Z coordinate in the XYZ tiling scheme

x.name: x
x.description: X coordinate in the XYZ tiling scheme. Must be less than 2^zoom

y.name: y
y.description: Y coordinate in the XYZ tiling scheme. Must be less than 2^zoom

tile_color.name: color
tile_color.description:
Primary color to use in tile creation. Accepts common colors by string
(e.g. `color=blue`), and accepts escaped color HEX codes
(e.g. `color=%2386a91c`)

date_field.name: date_field
date_field.description: Histogram basis: when the observation was created or observed

interval.name: interval
interval.description:
Time interval for histogram, with groups starting on or contained within
the group value. The year, month, week, day, and hour options will set
default values for `d1` or `created_d1` depending on the value of
`date_field`, to limit the number of groups returned. You can override
those values if you want data from a longer or shorter time span. The
`hour` interval only works with `date_field=created`, and this you
should filter dates with `created_d[1,2]`

created_after.name: created_after
created_after.description: Must be created at or after this time

viewed.name: viewed
viewed.description: Notification has been viewed by the user before

observations_by.name: observations_by
observations_by.description:
Only show updates on observations owned by the currently authenticated
user or on observations the authenticated user is following but does not
own.

since.name: since
since.description: Deleted at or after this time

ids_current_taxon.name: current_taxon
ids_current_taxon.description: ID's taxon is the same it's observation's taxon

ids_own_observation.name: own_observation
ids_own_observation.description: ID was added by the observer

ids_is_change.name: is_change
ids_is_change.description: ID was created as a results of a taxon change

ids_taxon_active.name: taxon_active
ids_taxon_active.description: ID's taxon is currently an active taxon

ids_observation_taxon_active.name: observation_taxon_active
ids_observation_taxon_active.description: Observation's taxon is currently an active taxon

ids_rank.name: rank
ids_rank.description: ID's taxon must have this rank

ids_observation_rank.name: observation_rank
ids_observation_rank.description: Observation's taxon must have this rank

ids_user_id.name: user_id
ids_user_id.description: Identifier must have this user ID

ids_current.name: current
ids_current.description: Most recent ID on a observation by a user

ids_place_id.name: place_id
ids_place_id.description: Observation must occur in this place

ids_quality_grade.name: quality_grade
ids_quality_grade.description: Observation must have this quality grade

ids_taxon_id.name: taxon_id
ids_taxon_id.description: ID taxa must match the given taxa or their descendants

ids_observation_taxon_id.name: observation_taxon_id
ids_observation_taxon_id.description: Observation taxa must match the given taxa or their descendants

ids_lrank.name: lrank
ids_lrank.description: ID taxon must have this rank or higher

ids_hrank.name: hrank
ids_hrank.description: ID taxon must have this rank or lower

ids_observation_lrank.name: observation_lrank
ids_observation_lrank.description: Observation taxon must have this rank or higher

ids_observation_hrank.name: observation_hrank
ids_observation_hrank.description: Observation taxon must have this rank or lower

ids_without_taxon_id.name: ids_without_taxon_id
ids_without_taxon_id.description: Exclude IDs of these taxa and their descendants

ids_without_observation_taxon_id.name: ids_without_observation_taxon_id
ids_without_observation_taxon_id.description: Exclude IDs of observations of these taxa and their descendants

ids_d1.name: d1
ids_d1.description: ID created on or after this time

ids_d2.name: d2
ids_d2.description: ID created on or before this time

ids_observation_created_d1.name: observation_created_d1
ids_observation_created_d1.description: Observation created on or after this date

ids_observation_created_d2.name: observation_created_d2
ids_observation_created_d2.description: Observation created on or before this date

ids_observed_d1.name: observed_d1
ids_observed_d1.description: Observation observed on or after this date

ids_observed_d2.name: observed_d2
ids_observed_d2.description: Observation observed on or before this date

taxa_taxon_id.name: taxon_id
taxa_taxon_id.description: Only show taxa with this ID, or its descendants

all_names.name: all_names
all_names.description: Include all taxon names in the response

ids_taxon_change_id.name: taxon_change_id
ids_taxon_change_id.description: Only return identifications that were created as part of the specified taxon change

include_ancestors.name: include_ancestors
include_ancestors.description: Include taxon ancestors in the response

projects_radius.name: radius
projects_radius.description:
Must be within a {`radius`} kilometer circle around this lat/lng
(*lat, *lng, radius). Defaults to 500km

associated_place_id.name: place_id
associated_place_id.description: Must be associated with this place

featured.name: featured
featured.description: Must be marked featured for the relevant site

noteworthy.name: noteworthy
noteworthy.description: Must be marked noteworthy for the relevant site

projects_site_id.name: site_id
projects_site_id.description:
Site ID that applies to `featured` and `noteworthy`. Defaults to the site
of the authenticated user, or to the main iNaturalist site
https://www.inaturalist.org

type.name: type
type.description: Projects must be of this type

member_id.name: member_id
member_id.description: Project must have member with this user ID

project_type.name: project_type
project_type.description: Specify the type of project to return

skip_counts.name: skip_counts
skip_counts.description:
If counts are not needed, consider setting this to true to save on
processing time, resulting in faster responses

rule_details.name: rule_details
rule_details.description:
Return more information about project rules, for example return a full
taxon object instead of simply an ID

include_taxon_ancestors.name: include_taxon_ancestors
include_taxon_ancestors.description: Include taxon ancestors in the response

thread_id.description:
Identifier for the thread. Should be blank for new threads,
but when replying to an existing message, it should be set to
the thread_id of the message being replied to.

locale.description:
Locale code for language/region localization. See
https://github.com/inaturalist/inaturalist/tree/master/config/locales
for available locales. Valid strings can be derived from file
names, e.g. `es-MX` from `es-MX.yml`.

time_zone.description:
Default time zone for the user's observations. See
http://api.rubyonrails.org/classes/ActiveSupport/TimeZone.html
for a list of values.

place_id.description:
ID of the place for this user, customizes some common names and
default search parameters

icon.description: User's profile pic. Requires POST/PUT as a multipart request.

icon_delete.description: Set to true to remove the current user icon.

user_id.description:
ID of the user to whom this message belongs. Messages work like email,
so the sender gets a copy and the recipient gets a copy of each
message. This is always the authenticated user, so there's no real
need for a full user object.

thread_id.description:
Identifier for the message thread, generally the ID of the sender's
copy of the first message

thread_messages_count.description: Number of messages in this thread. Only included when threads=true

thread_flags.description:
Array of flags on messages in this thread. Only included when
threads=true

source_id.description:
Identifier for the iNat source record associated with this status,
retrievable via https://www.inaturalist.org/sources/:id.json
(this endpoint is not a part of our public API and is thus subject to
change or removal)

status.description:
Body of the status, often coded, particularly when the status comes
from the IUCN or NatureServe. Consult the authority and/or the
status URL for details about the meanings of codes.

status_name.description: Human-readable name of the status if it was coded.

iucn.description:
Coded value representing the equivalent IUCN status. Mappings:
NOT_EVALUATED = 0, DATA_DEFICIENT = 5, LEAST_CONCERN = 10,
NEAR_THREATENED = 20, VULNERABLE = 30, ENDANGERED = 40,
CRITICALLY_ENDANGERED = 50, EXTINCT_IN_THE_WILD = 60, EXTINCT = 70

geoprivacy.description: Default geoprivacy for observations of this taxon in the status's place.
